intro: Gleichenia yungensis, commonly known as the Yung Valley fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Gleicheniaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Yungas region of Bolivia and Peru. This plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often on rocky or forested slopes. Gleichenia yungensis has a distinctive frond structure with a tall, narrow stem and pinnate leaves. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
